meanings.definition: To connect or link together in a chain or series.
meanings.sent1: The children were interchaining their toy cars to create a long line.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys interchaining colorful beads to make unique jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys started interchaining bananas in a playful game.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to be interchaining, forming a celestial necklace.
meanings.sent5: The dancers interchained their movements gracefully, like a synchronized dance.

meanings.definition: To exchange or swap items in a sequential manner.
meanings.sent1: During the game, players can interchain cards with each other.
meanings.sent2: The siblings often interchain their books to read different genres.
meanings.sent3: The students began interchaining snacks during the break.
meanings.sent4: The birds interchained feathers as they preened each other.
meanings.sent5: The traders interchained goods along the ancient trade route.
